description.plain:
Jaymes Mcfarland, better known by his stage name Jaymes Young, (born September 1, 1991) is an American singer-songwriter. He lived in Seattle, Washington as a child with his 3 siblings. He says his musical muses consisted of Amy Winehouse, Maroon 5, Death Cab for Cutie, and several others.

In 2013, Young released his debut EP Dark Star and the following year he released his second EP Habits of My Heart.

Jaymes' debut full-length album Feel Something was released on June 23, 2017.

body.plain:
Jaymes Mcfarland, better known by his stage name Jaymes Young, (born September 1, 1991) is an American singer-songwriter. He lived in Seattle, Washington as a child with his 3 siblings. He says his musical muses consisted of Amy Winehouse, Maroon 5, Death Cab for Cutie, and several others.

In 2013, Young released his debut EP Dark Star and the following year he released his second EP Habits of My Heart.

Jaymes' debut full-length album Feel Something was released on June 23, 2017.

songs.full_title: Habits of My Heart by Jaymes Young
songs.title: Habits of My Heart

description.plain:
Habits of My Hearts was the debut track from the second EP, with the same title as the track, Habits of My Heart EP. The song was released on March 20, 2014 and was sampled from Sufjan Stevens' “Concerning the UFO Sighting Near Highland, Illinois”. In one of his interview, Young said that this song was the least planned of all five tracks on the EP.

This song is about an abusive relationship where his partner mistreats Jaymes. It is also about mixing up love and lust and how that can mess somebody up.

songs.lyrics:
27 ContributorsHabits of My Heart Lyrics[Intro]
I can't, say no
It's ripping me apart

[Verse 1]
In a dark room, in cold sheets
I can't feel a damn thing
I lost myself between your legs
Your medicine is in my head

[Pre-Chorus]
You know I'd rather be alone, yeah
But then you call me on the phone
[Chorus]
Oh, the habits of my heart
I can't say no
It's ripping me apart
You get too close
You make it hard to let you go

[Verse 2]
I tell myself "I like that"
When you tie my hands behind my back
You're confident, I'll give you that
But if you love yourself, you can fuck yourself

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cause I'd rather be alone
But you fermented in my bones

[Chorus]
Oh, the habits of my heart
I can't say no
It's ripping me apart
You get too close
You make it hard to let you go
Oh, the habits of my heart
I can't say no
It's ripping me apart
You get too close
You make it hard to let you go
You might also likeOh, the habits of my heart
I can't say no
It's ripping me apart
You get too close...9Embed

songs.full_title: I'll Be Good by Jaymes Young
songs.title: I’ll Be Good

description.plain:
“I’ll Be Good” is the first single from Jaymes Young’s second EP, Habits Of My Heart and it’s the eleventh track on Young’s debut full-length album Feel Something.

About the music video for “I’ll Be Good,” Jaymes said:

This video represents the harm we do. We harm ourselves when we harm others. It also reflects the re-birth of a forgiven conscience.

songs.lyrics:
40 ContributorsTranslationsPolskiTürkçeI’ll Be Good Lyrics[Verse 1]
I thought I saw the devil this morning
Looking in the mirror
Drop of rum on my tongue with a warning
To help me see myself clearer

[Pre-Chorus]
I never meant to start a fire
I never meant to make you bleed
I'll be a better man today
[Chorus]
I'll be good, I'll be good
And I'll love the world like I should
I'll be good, I'll be good
For all of the times that I never could

[Verse 2]
My past has tasted bitter for years now so I wield an iron fist
Grace is just weakness, or so I've been told
I've been cold, I've been merciless

[Pre-Chorus]
But the blood on my hands scares me to death
Maybe I'm waking up today

[Chorus]
I'll be good, I'll be good
And I'll love the world like I should
I'll be good, I'll be good
(I'll be good, I'll be good)

[Bridge]
For all of the light that I shut out
For all of the innocent things that I doubt
For all of the bruises I've caused and the tears
For all of the things that I've done
All these years, no, yeah
For all of the sparks that I stomped out
For all of the perfect things that I doubt
You might also like[Chorus]
I'll be good, I'll be good
And I'll love the world like I should yeah
I'll be good, I'll be good
For all of the times I never could
For all of the times I never could38Embed
